contextId.information: These words have similar meaning and emphasize how great his kingdom was. AT: "the great wealth of his kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: the wealth of the splendor of his kingdom

contextId.information: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize how much she pleased him. AT: "The young girl greatly pleased him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: The young girl pleased him, and she found favor with him

contextId.information: The words "petition" and "request" mean the same thing. She probably used these words together as a way of speaking very formally and respectfully to the king. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
